Manage your subscription here Activate subscription            One in four scientists have experienced harassment or discrimination  A survey of nearly 3700 scientists across Europe and North America suggests that harassment, bullying and discrimination are widespread         Life   20 March 2019     Cavan Images/Getty By Clare Wilson  A QUARTER of people working in science have experienced sexual harassment, bullying and discrimination over issues ranging from disabilities to diet.  The 2019 New Scientist/SRG Salary Survey polled nearly 3700 people across Europe and North America who worked in academia, industry and government agencies. The data revealed a gap of about £10,000 between the average salaries of male and female respondents in the UK.
